website_summaries.verdict: The Memorex Mega TravelDrive is a novel combination of large capacity and tiny size, but it's just that: a novelty. Its slow speeds and high per-gigabyte cost (for a hard drive) make it a hard sell.
pros: large capacity for its physical size
cons: Expensive compared to 2.5-inch portable hard drives

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Travel Drive because it was the largest capacity small drive I could find. Plus I trusted the Memorex brand. What a mistake. Mine just died after 8 weeks of use. Because I rely on it for my work I need it replaced ASAP but I first have to e-mail Memorex, who says they will respond the next day, and then my drive will be replaced in 3-4 weeks! Considering that the drive is an expensive and crucial piece of hardware I would think they could replace it sooner than that, like in a day or two. This is the last time I'll be buying any Memorex product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this piece of JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these from a daily deal site. I took the first one out of the package this morning, to transfer files from one computer to another. I loaded one file from the first computer, and by the time I got it to the second computer the thing was DOA. Won't even try the others, I need more dependability with my data, and expected much more from Memorex!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: Consider a flash drive instead!
customer_reviews.text: Be wary of this and other microdrives! Mine first unit lasted a couple of months and just today-less than a year later-another bites the dust. Since these devices have moving parts they are prone to breaking without warning. Both units of mine were not dropped or experience any extreme conditions but failed anyway. I will purchase flash drives from now on.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jablonkay

customer_reviews.title: worked great and then bam! dead
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great and was quite useful because of its large capacity but small size (most thumb drives are 1 or 2 GB), but it crashed without warning. All the data is lost and there is no way to recover it, even by professionals. What a waste! Stay away. Memorax is great for CDs and DVDs, not so great for HDs.
customer_reviews.author: AIROLF

customer_reviews.title: Good idea bad implementation
customer_reviews.text: I saw the drive on the shelf at my local electronics store and was like sweet this is not much more then the 4gb flashdrive. The problem is I dropped it 2 feet while not plugged in and it died. Not very good for a portable device. Memorex said they would replace it but that cost extra money for S&H to fix a product that would still be broken as designed.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Marjie

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, until it died 2 weeks later.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same experience. At first it was great, being able to carry so much data around on my hip and for my work it was really essential. Then the honeymoon was over and after about 2 weeks it would just spin and click - dead. I have a replacement request submitted to Memorex but I am going to be nervous about the new one too. I'd steer clear of this item.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: No chance for use
customer_reviews.text: I had the Memorex mega traveler in my closet for a while. I finally decided to use it. I inserted it into my laptop and it worked for a few minutes, then it died. I attempted to recover what I had on the drive with no success. Do not buy this product; it is not even a one star. It is a negative(-) 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of tech!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new in 2005. IT has worked flawlessly ever since. I am currently using it right now in fact - 8 years later. Fantastic little micro hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mine died after 11 days
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it beats a USB flash drive because it's a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Mine is a dead player
customer_reviews.text: I have the 2008, smaller version of this and it has died after very little use!
customer_reviews.author: E. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk
customer_reviews.text: This device worked for 2 weeks then it died. Complete picece of junk. Do NOT purchase. This apparently is a complete lemon and Memorex should be embarrassed to have its name on it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.
